column5: So I'm running out of names for new fishing spots I'm finding... My fishing journal is getting confusing.... Lol  So I was wondering if you guys would post up some names for spots like... points... Banks... Rocks/stones.... Ripples... Etc...  In all seriousness I will be using a lot of these names....  I'm just not a super creative person....  Thanks...
Name some for the common wildflowers around them, like 'Aster Bay',  'Trillium Creek', etc. Just stay away from 'Poison Ivy Pond'.
Bikini Bay , Snag Pile , Stump Dump , Split Lip, Steven Seagull , Prop Rock , Li'l Dinks ... or how about naming your spots after OFC member names ?
That's not a bad idea...  "Mercman's mud flat"  Lol
Name them the date you first fished or discovered them?
Yeah sure...then all his LM Bass spots will be called Roy.
Waypoint 134.. 135... 136... 137 My lowrance don't give me names...
Lmao.....

Thought about that...  With 300+ waypoints I think that would be confusing looking back years later at info....  ... Well 3 years ago when the water was 66 degrees we caught fish at waypoint 112... 228... And 301.... Where's that?.... Lemme check my GPS....  Most spots I try to name them based on something I can remember... For example... I have a spot I call "The dead cow"... Because its the closest spot I fish to the dead cow I found this spring...
I actually keep journals for lakes lol. I make notes on water temp, structure species etc. so my way points are easily found in my journal

The lakes are easy, it's rivers that are tough. Rainy river for example, for years we had a sandbar off a point that was deadly for walleye pre and post spawn. 2 years later and it's all rock now. The river is constantly changing. I find water levels to be the most confusing to figure out year to year
Tell me where they are and I'll dream up some suitable names for you!!

I have fun naming all the coves and structure in the ponds out back. Makes for easy reference points as to where I caught a fish. I dunno what I'd do if I got to 300 waypoints though, lol grab a dictionary and pick random words!
I generally name my spots after people Ive fished them with or something unique that happened there. Banana Hole,Robbies Run, Power Grub riffle etc.
Lets see I have  hill, Gay Bay, and Ken's Is. Yes they all have stories.
As long as nobody else on the planet knows where Chipmunk Cove, Butt's Bay and Sauna Rock Shoal are, I'll be happy. Just a few of the creative names that my Buds and I have made up.
Does it makes sense to you to try to have a formula for spots? Species, bottom type etc?
I'd just call them waypoint 123 etc. as time passes they should earn their own nicknames based on your experiences good or bad.
That would be way cool !!! Just stay away from Mercs Rockpile.
That one is "half throttle hell".... Lmao
If "banana hole" has a story - please don't share it here as this forum is family friendly!!!
